did.unittitle: William Kelly Simpson Archives

repository.corpname: Yale Peabody Museum of Natural History

did.abstract: The archives of William Simpson, accumulated during his time at Yale.

prefercite.head: Cite As
prefercite.p: William Kelly Simpson Archives, Anthropology, Yale Peabody Museum

bioghist.head: Biographical Sketch
bioghist.p: Simpson, William Kelly (b.1928) was appointed to the Yale faculty in 1958. His interests embrace nearly every aspect of Egyptology, including history, literature, art, and archaeology. His numerous books include publications of the Pennsylvania-Yale Expedition to Egypt, Giza mastabas, several volumes of papyri and other Egyptian writings, a standard history of Egypt, and an anthology of Egyptian literature in translation. He is author of nearly 150 articles in the field of Egyptology and serves as editor of the Yale Egyptological Studies. He also served as one of several co-directors of the University of Pennsylvania Museum-Yale University Expedition to Abydos, Egypt.

scopecontent.head: Description of the Material
scopecontent.p: The archives of William Simpson, accumulated during his time at Yale relating to objects curated at the Peabody Museum.

did.unittitle: Photographs
Aminna and Toshka. 35mm Negatives from Penn-Yale Expedition to Nubia.

Miscellaneous. Slides from Penn-Yale Expedition to Nubia.

Teaching Collection Slides. Medium format glass-mounted black-and-white slides (glass10 cm H x 8.2 cm W; various image sizes). Count of 35 slides from the William Kelly Simpson teaching collection: 9 ofTell Basta; 5 of Sakkara; 2 of Giza; 5 of Dashur; 4 unlabeled texts; 3 unlabeled rock engravings; 6 unlabeled images of statuary; 1 rock engraving labeled "Edward Van Altena".

Teaching Collection Slides. 35mm slides from the William Kelly Simpson teaching collection. Count of 49 black and white / color slides. Miscellaneous Pre-Dynastic, Early Dynastic and Old Kingdom slides. Various images of sculpture, architecture, maps, paintings, and rock engravings.

Teaching Collection Slides. 35mm slides from the William Kelly Simpson teaching collection. Count of 75 various black and white / color slides; Middle Kingdom. Images of sculpture, maps, texts, and rock engravings. 1 from Dynasty 11; 63 from Dynasty 12; 11 slides various Middle Kingdom.

Teaching Collection Slides. 35mm slides from the William Kelly Simpson teaching collection. Count of 77 various black and white / color slides. Middle Kingdom and Second Intermediate Period. Images of sculpture, architecture and rock inscriptions. 42 slides from Dynasty 12; 1 from dynasty 12-13; 3 from Dynasty 13; 4 from Byblos; 9 miscellaneous;19 from the Second Intermediate Period.

Teaching Collection Slides. 35mm slides from the William Kelly Simpson teaching collection. Count of 109 various black and white / color slides; images of sculpture, wall paintings, architecture and rock engravings. New Kingdom, 18th Dynasty, mainly tombs of Paatenemheb, Paheri, Horemheb; also 50 from Luxor; 10 of the Tjawy Relief.

Teaching Collection Slides. 35mm slides from the William Kelly Simpson teaching collection. Count of 69 various black and white / color slides; various images of sculpture, ceramics, landscapes, and architecture. New Kingdom, mostly from Amarna, Dynasty 18; also 20 miscellaneous New Kingdom slides.

Teaching Collection Slides. 35mm slides from the William Kelly Simpson teaching collection. Count of 101 black and white / color slides. New Kingdom Amarna, 18th dynasty; various images of sculpture, reliefs, engravings, architecture, and maps.

Teaching Collection Slides. 35mm slides from the William Kelly Simpson teaching collection. Count of 72 various black and white / color slides; various images of sculpture, architecture, and rock inscriptions. New Kingdom, 18th dynasty. 29 from Deir el Bahri; 11 of Hatshepsut (Deir el Bahri); 17 of Senmut; 3 of the Hyksos Dagger; 12 miscellaneous.
Teaching Collection Slides. 35mm slides from the William Kelly Simpson teaching collection. Count of 107 black and white / color slides; all 18th Dynasty reliefs, sculpture, artifacts, and statuary.

Teaching Collection Slides. 35mm slides from the William Kelly Simpson teaching collection. Count of 105 black and white / color slides. New Kingdom, 18th Dynasty sculpture and statuary; 19th Dynasty reliefs and sculpture; 19th-20th Dynasty writing, maps, and hieroglyphs; miscellaneous New Kingdom objects and artifacts.

Teaching Collection Slides. 35mm slides from the William Kelly Simpson teaching collection. Count of 48 various black and white / color slides; various images of architecture, drawings, sculpture, and rock engravings. New Kingdom, Medinet Habu (18th to 20th Dynasties). Glass slides bound with red tape are fragile, handle with care.

Teaching Collection Slides. 35mm slides from the William Kelly Simpson teaching collection. Count of 99 black and white / color slides. New Kingdom, Thebes, 18th Dynasty. Slides featuring Khaemhat, Talatat, Rekhmire, and Ramose.

Teaching Collection Slides. 35mm slides from the William Kelly Simpson teaching collection. Count of 84 black and white / color slides. New Kingdom, Thebes, Dynasty 18-20. Slides featuring Menna, Tjanuni, Userehet, Kherouef, the Ramesseum, and miscellaneous slides.

Teaching Collection Slides. 35mm slides from the William Kelly Simpson teaching collection. Count of 74 black and white / color slides. New Kingdom, Thebes, mostly architectural features and wall paintings. Glass slides bound with red tape are fragile, handle with care.

Teaching Collection Slides. 35mm slides from the William Kelly Simpson teaching collection. Count of 91 various black and white / color slides; various images of architecture, drawings, sculpture, and rock engravings. New Kingdom, mostly 19th dynasty. 19 from Abu Simbel; 21 from Abydos; 16 of Ramses II; 24 of Seti I; 11 miscellaneous 19th and 20th Dynasty slides.

Teaching Collection Slides. 35mm slides from the William Kelly Simpson teaching collection. Count of 105 black and white / color slides. 70 slides of 18th-20th dynasty Karnak. 35 slides from the Third Intermediate Period, Dynasties 21-25; slides featuring reliefs, statuary, and vessels.

Teaching Collection Slides. 35mm slides from the William Kelly Simpson teaching collection. Count of 82 black and white / color slides. 32 Late Dynastic slides (Dynasties 26, 27, 30); 36 Ptolemaic/Roman Period slides; 21 Miscellaneous slides. Slides feature statuary and architecture.

Teaching Collection Slides. 35mm slides from the William Kelly Simpson teaching collection. Count of 102 black and white / color slides, miscellaneous modern diagrams, drawings, architectural features, and objects.

Teaching Collection Slides. 35mm slides from the William Kelly Simpson teaching collection. Count of 119 black and white / color slides; various unlabeled miscellaneous sculpture, reliefs, landscapes, and drawings. 48 empty labeled cardboard slide frames.

Teaching Collection Slides. 35mm slides from the William Kelly Simpson teaching collection. Count of 92 black and white / color slides. 18 possibly from the 1960's Pennsylvania-Yale Expedition; 14 personal photos of a mansion; 16 travel slides from Aswan, Luxor and Cairo; 23 labeled "Robert E. Murowchick 1977"; 16 from a 1970s expedition; 5 miscellaneous.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Field notes, find cards, and smaller illustrations stored in one box (along with Arminna West field notes, box 1 of 3). Oversize illustrations and images stored separately.

Arminna West. Classic Christian Townsite Pottery Classification Forms. These forms are stored in two boxes due to volume.The "Classic Christian Townsite" was originally identified as a Monastery. References in Field Notes to "Monastery" are referring to this site. Box 1 contains folders 1-7: (1) No Room Number; (2) Room 001, Level 5 to Room 002/014, Level 2/3; (3) Room 003, Level 1 to Room 004/005, Level 2; (4) Room 005, Level 1 to Room 011, Level 2; (5) Room 012 "Oven" to Room 012b, Level 3; (6) Room 012c "Oven" to Room 012e, Level 4; (7) Room 012f, Level 2 to Room 013, Level 2. Box 2 contains folders 8-14: (8) Room 031 to Room 037; (9) Room 060, Level 1 to Room 068, Level 2; (10) Room 101 Level 1 to Room 105 "Fill to Floor"; (11) Room 106, Level 1 to Room 106 "Fill"; (12) Room 107, Level 1 to Room 110c, Level 1; (13) Room 111, Level 1 to Room 111c+d, Level 1; (14) Room 201, Level 1 to Room 203, Level 2, and miscellaneous papers.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Field notes, excavation and find cards, and smaller illustrations stored in one box. Oversize illustrations stored separately.

did.unittitle: Toshka East, Crevice. Drawings. Photocopies of hieroglyphic graffiti with pencilled annotations; sheets fit together to make one image. Toshka East, crevice. Each sheet 26.8 cm L x 24.2 cm W. Graffiti description, sheet #1): Hekanefer No. 3, from west wall, southern half. Sheet #2) Hekanefer No. 1, from tomb site between Tombs I and II; Hekanefer No. 4, from crevice south wall; right-side portion of Hekanefer No. 3, from west wall southern half. Sheet #3) graffito of Re-Hotep, etc., from crevice west wall northern half. Publication: Simpson, "Hekanefer", Fig. 20, p.25.
